profile.name: Jayesh Kumar Goyal
profile.bio: I create software and AI/ML solutions with a focus on clarity, reliability, and real user impact. From idea to iteration, I ship working products, test what matters, and refine with feedback.

timeline.title: Software Engineer Intern
timeline.shortDescription: Building AI-powered project management features with FastAPI and GenAI pipelines.
timeline.description: Built AI powered project management features by integrating FastAPI services with GenAI pipelines using LangGraph, Vertex AI, and RAG, deployed as Dockerized services on Google Cloud Platform.
highlights: Implemented FastAPI services and integrated with the WordPress site via REST/webhooks and React widgets, reducing duplicate task updates and manual PM steps by 35%.
Designed GenAI pipelines (OpenAI API, Vertex AI) using LangGraph + RAG with ChromaDB, improving retrieval quality for project docs and supporting 1,000+ automated queries.
Contributed to containerization with Docker and CI/CD on GCP, adding staged checks and release gating,increasing pre-release success by 20% across iterations.

timeline.title: Machine Learning Research Assistant
timeline.shortDescription: Developing RL agents and game mods for colony task efficiency research.
timeline.description: Built RL agents in Python (Pytorch) and a C# RimWorld game mod that streams real time gameplay events, improving colony task efficiency and enabling controlled evaluations with SwiftTD algorithm.
highlights: Developed Reinforcement Learning agents in Python (PyTorch) and a C# .NET RimWorld game mod that streamed real-time gameplay event data to enhance colony task efficiency.
Trained and evaluated RL agents under Vanilla and Free Will survival policies in a standardized resource-stress testbed, applied the SwiftTD algorithm to refine behavior.

Analyzed agent‚Äìenvironment logs to identify mood drivers and performed baseline comparisons, controlled experiments, and error analyses with NumPy/Matplotlib to prepare a conference-style research paper draft.

timeline.title: Teaching Assistant
timeline.shortDescription: Teaching and mentoring students in Python, testing, and code quality.
timeline.description: Created responsive websites and web applications for various clients, focusing on performance and user experience.
highlights: Led labs and tutorials for 500+ students, improving student lab performance through academic support.
Automated grading with Python, Bash, and PyTest, reducing evaluation time by 40% while ensuringconsistency, mentored students on testing and code quality.

timeline.title: Academic Tutor
timeline.shortDescription: Teaching and mentoring students in CMPUT, Math, and Stat through one-to-one support.
timeline.description: Provided personalized tutoring for CMPUT, Math, and Stat courses, creating study plans, practice sets, and review sessions that helped students improve outcomes.
highlights: Delivered 100+ hours of one-to-one tutoring across CMPUT, MATH, and STAT.
Created individualized study plans and weekly checkpoints, boosting grades by ~30%.
Developed practice problems, Python notebooks, and solution walkthroughs for core topics.
Coached students on debugging, testing, and code quality to strengthen fundamentals.
Tracked progress with shared notes and spreadsheets to keep sessions focused and effective.

volunteer.title: Upper Bound Conference 2025
highlights: Supported a major AI conference hosting ~6,000 attendees and over 200 sessions.
Assisted conference logistics: registration, way-finding, headphones, session staffing, speaker support.
Facilitated attendee experience at Edmonton Convention Centre.

volunteer.title: 'Root for Trees' Planting
highlights: Planted native trees in urban parks to support Edmonton‚Äôs urban forest initiative.
Ensured safe, effective planting at drop-in and group events.
Contributed to city-wide biodiversity goal (~45‚ÄØ000 plantings/year).

projects.title: Wealth.io
projects.shortDescription: Unified banking hub to view and manage accounts from multiple institutions
projects.longDescription: Wealth.io is a branded showcase app that solves the pain of switching between different banking apps by bringing balances, transactions, and profile details into a single clean dashboard. It includes KYC style onboarding, secure authentication, and a consolidated view of mock multi bank data for learning and demos. Built with the Next.js app router, TypeScript, Tailwind, and shadcn ui, and deployed on Vercel with Sentry for observability.
highlights: Built a full-stack financial dashboard with Next.js 14, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS for modern UI/UX
Integrated Plaid API for secure bank account connections and real-time transaction data processing
Implemented KYC-style onboarding flow with document verification and identity validation
Deployed on Vercel with Sentry monitoring for production-grade error tracking and performance analytics
challenges: Implementing secure financial data handling and compliance with banking regulations
Creating a seamless user experience for multi-bank account aggregation
Building robust error handling and data validation for financial transactions
results: Successfully integrated 3+ banking institutions through Plaid API
Achieved 90% uptime with comprehensive error monitoring
Implemented secure authentication with JWT tokens and session management

projects.title: DriveSafe
projects.shortDescription: Driver alertness monitoring app using EEG signals and facial analysis
projects.longDescription: DriveSafe unifies neurotech and computer vision to detect drowsiness and keep drivers safe. A Muse S headset streams EEG data to estimate concentration and fatigue while OpenCV tracks facial landmarks to catch eye closure and yawning. When alertness drops, the app issues instant voice prompts. Built with a React frontend and a Flask backend for low latency streaming, plus a weather API to factor external conditions. The project showcases an end to end safety pipeline from sensor ingestion to real time feedback.
highlights: Developed real-time drowsiness detection using EEG signals from Muse S headset and OpenCV facial analysis
Built Flask backend with low-latency streaming for processing sensor data and generating instant alerts
Integrated weather API to factor external conditions affecting driver alertness and fatigue levels
Created React frontend with responsive design for real-time monitoring dashboard and alert management
challenges: Processing real-time EEG data streams with minimal latency for immediate alert generation
Integrating multiple data sources (EEG, facial analysis, weather) for accurate drowsiness detection
Creating intuitive user interface for complex sensor data visualization
results: Achieved 95% accuracy in drowsiness detection through multi-modal sensor fusion
Reduced alert response time to under 2 seconds for critical safety situations
Successfully integrated neurotechnology with computer vision for comprehensive monitoring

projects.title: CrowdNav
projects.shortDescription: Live crowd analysis with optimal pathfinding between two different locations.
projects.longDescription: A computer vision app that converts live crowd recordings into weighted heatmaps and computes safer, faster routes between locations. Uses OpenCV for density estimation and Dijkstra's algorithm for path selection, with a React front end and Python backend.
highlights: Implemented computer vision algorithms using OpenCV for real-time crowd density estimation and analysis
Developed Dijkstra's pathfinding algorithm to compute optimal routes avoiding high-density areas
Built React frontend with interactive maps and real-time visualization of crowd patterns
Created Python Flask backend for processing video streams and generating route recommendations
challenges: Processing live video streams with high accuracy for crowd density estimation
Implementing efficient pathfinding algorithms for real-time route optimization
Creating responsive user interface for dynamic crowd visualization
results: Successfully processed live video streams with 90% accuracy in crowd density detection
Implemented pathfinding algorithm that reduces travel time by 25% in crowded areas
Created interactive visualization system for real-time crowd monitoring and navigation

projects.title: Feelin'
projects.shortDescription: Android mood tracking app with offline mode, maps, and social sharing.
projects.longDescription: An Android app where users log mood events with time, emotion, triggers, social context, and optional location. Features include a reverse-chronological mood history, filters (by date range, emotion, and keyword), interactive map views, following other users (with permission), offline add/edit/delete with auto-sync, and basic mood analytics (calendar and graph).
highlights: Developed native Android app using Java and Android Studio with Firebase backend integration
Implemented offline-first architecture with auto-sync capabilities for seamless user experience
Built interactive map views using Google Maps API for location-based mood tracking and visualization
Created comprehensive mood analytics with calendar views, graphs, and advanced filtering options
challenges: Implementing robust offline data synchronization with conflict resolution
Creating intuitive user interface for complex mood tracking and analytics
Integrating multiple data sources (location, time, social context) for comprehensive mood analysis
results: Achieved 100% offline functionality with seamless data synchronization
Implemented advanced filtering system supporting 5+ filter criteria simultaneously
Created comprehensive analytics dashboard with 10+ visualization options
